title: Day 22: It's finally looking like a theater
body: The theater really started to take shape today. It's amazing what dramatic lighting and additional coats of paint can do to an old bank. Tomorrow will be one of the most important days in the life of the Moxie - the projector installer will be down. He's not actually installing anything tomorrow (it's just a site review), but he will be passing judgment on all the work we've done thus far. What will I do if he steps into the projection booth and says, "Nope. This is far too small. It's not going to work." I'd probably blurt out some random word and then stick my finger into the power panel. HUSKER DU! *sticks finger in panel* Bzzzzzt I hope it doesn't come to that. Either way, dead or not, I'm still nervous. My face is breaking out like Clint Eastwood with a papier-mache dummy head. It's terrible. I won't even talk about the fire down below... you know, that movie with Steven Segal. So, I met with some plumbers today. The first crew was a little shady - as in, they threatened to shoot me if I didn't hire them - but the second plumber was perfect. If I had a dream plumber, the second guy would be it. His quote was half the price of the first dude's bid, AND he didn't smell like stale funnel cakes. As it turns out, the dream plumber had already done work in our building... back when Andrew and Doug bought it in 2001. He's already familiar with our pipes (insert dirty joke here). The first plumber is going to kill me, isn't he. So, here are today's pictures: See what I mean?! The lighting really pulls things together! Check out the art hall! Don't you think the red wall would look good with some BIG vintage posters on it? Each one with it's own spot light! That would be AWESOME! Here's Dad installing the drop ceiling behind the Cinebar. More Cinebar drop ceiling. And this is what the men's restroom will look like. The right wall will have a giant collage of actresses on it, but I haven't gotten around to making that yet. There will also be a pee pee guard that sits behind the toilet, thus the large square of unfinished wall. Big thanks to Justin (as per usual) and Mom and Dad's friend John, who both helped paint today. Nicole spent the day doing administrative stuff like contacting food suppliers, e-mailing film distributors, working out our schedule with Paul, and eating bon bons on the couch. My Mom and Dad have been helping nearly every single night (especially Dad, who's been helping nearly every single night since JANUARY), so a HUGE thanks goes out to them as well. It's really starting to come along, folks. Can you feel the excitement?!!!
author: Dan
